title.narrative: MONITORING AND EVALUATION

description.narrative: Effective support is provided to strengthen M&E skills and capacities to ensure high impact of the UNICEF programme in Brazil., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: UNICEF's 2012-2016 Country Programme for Brazil is effectively implemented, and Brazil's situation is monitored and evaluated in an integrated and efficient manner, with an equity approach and integrating cross-cutting issues that address the various dimensions of inequality in the country.

participating-org.narrative: ASSOC VOLUNTARIOS PARA O SERVICO INTERNACIONAL
FUNDACAO PARA O DESENVOLVIMENTO CIENTIFICO E TECNOLOGICO EM SAUDE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Effective support is provided to strengthen M&E skills and capacities to ensure high impact of the UNICEF programme in Brazil.

description.narrative: Monitoring and Evaluation continued to be a key cross-cutting area in UNICEF Brazil and the M&E team worked across all BCO's programme sections to support the knowledge management and promote organizational learning | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of strategic programme evaluations carried out by UNICEF, with an equity focus, and according to UNEG standards

actual.value: 2016:Achieved. Youth Aware (Fique Sabendo Jovem) Evaluation has been concluded.Evaluative monitoring process of PCU has been concluded.

title.narrative: Percentage of UNICEF products involving data reviewed by and with substantive contributions from the M&E team

actual.value: 2016:Achieved.100% of knowledge products, publications, briefings and speeches produced by UNICEF Brazil have been reviewed by and received contributions from the M&E team.

title.narrative: M&E Team with adequate planning, implementation and learning.

actual.value: 2016:Achieved. Three presential meetings held: team meetings during office retreats, M&E meeting in August. All M&E team members went on external training, including one stretch assignment, two international conferences, several national events.

title.narrative: Rate of implementation of activities in the IMEP

actual.value: 2016:Achieved. The rate of implementation as of this moment is 100% (completed or on track).

title.narrative: Quality of project proposals, logframes and M&E plans developed by UNICEF staff

baseline.value: good, but with no systematic support from the M&E team

actual.value: 2016:Achieved. All PCAs and SSFAs approved by the PRC have been supported by the M&E team, both during preparation (M&E officers in the platforms) and during final review (M&E Chief and OIC). M&E officers in the platforms are involved in monitoring PCAs as needed. Areas to improve: M&E officers' enga
